sections.title: Organisational purpose
sections.description: A well-run board is clear about the purpose and values of the organisation and how it will achieve its aims.

sections.title: Leadership
sections.description: A well-run board is clear about its role and responsibilities, and provides strategic direction in line with the organisationâ€™s purpose, vision and values.

sections.title: Board behaviour
sections.description: A well-run board, both collectively and individually, embraces and demonstrates mutual respect, integrity, openness and accountability.

sections.title: Control
sections.description: A well-run board will develop and implement appropriate controls to direct and oversee progress and performance of the organisation.

sections.title: Effectiveness
sections.description: A well-run board understands its role, powers and duties and works collectively and proactively, to achieve its organisational purpose.
